turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Explosion of the RFA Bedenham.
turn.1: What was the Explosion of the RFA Bedenham?
turn.2: Explosion of the RFA Bedenham The Naval Armament vessel formerly RFA "Bedenham" was a naval armament carrier that exploded while docked in Gibraltar on 27 April 1951, killing 13 people and causing a great deal of damage to the town.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The "Bedenham" had arrived in Gibraltar on 24 April 1951, tying up at Gun Wharf.
turn.6: On the morning of 27 April, depth charges were being unloaded into a lighter when one of them ignited.
turn.8: Several men were organised to fight the fire from the quayside, but to no avail.
turn.10: All the other fighters had withdrawn but George Campbell Henderson, a sub-officer with the dockyard fire service who doggedly held a firehose into the fire.
turn.11: Was anyone else injured or killed?
turn.12: There was an explosion in the lighter, and the fire spread to the "Bedenham", causing a violent explosion in which the bow was blown out of the water and onto Gun Wharf, while the rest of the ship sank.
